body_html:
I thinks this is somewhat strange. Of the 4 tests which failed, 3 ran successfully (Windows Cmake Tests, Linux GPU, Linux CPU Tests) before the last revision. Since the last revision involved correcting one of the test functions (changing std::cos(x) to std::cosh(x)), it surprises me that tests in unrelated files are failing.

I ran the following commands on my machine and the tests were successful (these failed on jenkins)

  1. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test
  2. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:embedding_ops_test
  3. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq:beam_search_decoder_test
  4. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:sparse_ops_test
  5. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq:basic_decoder_test
  6. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/layers:embedding_ops_test

Any hints on how to proceed?

body:
I thinks this is somewhat strange. Of the 4 tests which failed, 3 ran successfully (Windows Cmake Tests, Linux GPU, Linux CPU Tests) before the last revision. Since the last revision involved correcting one of the test functions (changing `std::cos(x)` to `std::cosh(x)`), it surprises me that tests in unrelated files are failing.

I ran the following commands on my machine and the tests were successful (these failed on jenkins)

1. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test 
2. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:embedding_ops_test
3. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq:beam_search_decoder_test
4. bazel test //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:sparse_ops_test
5. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq:basic_decoder_test
6. bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/layers:embedding_ops_test

Any hints on how to proceed?
